text: hello and welcome to the AWS cost
optimization Series in this episode we
are going to learn about AWS cost
categories
AWS has many services and tools that
help you to track your AWS spending so
you can make informed decisions about
cost optimization and find cost-saving
Opportunities to achieve that it would
be great for you to be able to group
your costs and usage information into
any groups that you like so that you can
make sense of your AWS spending data
within the context of your business well
that's exactly what AWS cost categories
allows you to do AWS cost categories is
a feature of AWS cost management and it
allows you to create custom categories
to which you can map your cost and usage
information based on rules that you
create using different cost Dimensions
such as service or charge type or
account or tags or even other cost
categories themselves once you set up
and enable your cost categories then at
the start of each month you will see the
aggregation of your cost and usage
information on other cost management
tool tools such as AWS cost Explorer AWS
budgets AWS cost detection anomaly and
AWS cost and usage report so let's have
a quick look at this so here we have a
snapshot of a an account that has some
costs um already attributed to it and
here we have four different categories
so we have cost owner Department project
and team and with each one of these
categories you will have different
groupings so for example within the team
category we may have Team Alpha and team
beta how do you tell them apart well you
pick your dimension for example we could
tag our Resources with Team Alpha and
therefore map that via row to our
grouping of Team Alpha and then we can
track the spending for that team
now another thing that you can do is
split the bill and this is a very cool
feature where you don't need to have a
single owner of your costs so for
example we have identify here a share
cost of
4378.80 but we don't want a single
entity to pick up that bill so what we
have done is said that this bill should
be split between Team Alpha and team
Beta And there are three different ways
to do this one pretty straightforward we
can evenly split that bill against those
targets secondly we can say that one of
those can should pick up a larger
portion of the bill so we could for
example attribute A Team Alpha to pick
up eighty percent of that bill leaving
the other 20 for team beta now lastly
you can do this proportionally so the
costs will be attributed to each one of
the groupings based on the
proportionally weighted Target value
costs
you can also create multi-hierarchical
views of your categories so you can
match it to your organizational
structure for example here we have
created the platform engineering
category and what we have done is used
the other cost categories to create this
one in this case we have used the team
category so what we're saying here is
that any costs attributed to Team Alpha
or team beta will actually be recognized
as platform engineering costs
lastly this is a dashboard where you get
to see a summary of all your costs and
your categories and then see a breakdown
of the costs and usage information that
you have aggregated under your cost
categories very Nifty and handy thank
you very much I hope I have learned
something new today keep on learning
keep on building on AWS
